unnormalised: New Delhi – The capital city is experiencing a significant drop in air quality following Diwali celebrations, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB). The Air Quality Index (AQI) has consistently remained in the ‘Severe’ category across multiple monitoring stations, including those at Anand Vihar and R.K. Puram.

unnormalised: Dr. Harsh Vardhan, noted environmentalist, urges citizens to minimize outdoor activities, especially those with respiratory ailments. The Delhi Government has implemented emergency measures, including increased water sprinkling and a temporary ban on construction activities exceeding 500 sq ft in certain high-risk zones.
